title: Diabetes Journal License
description:
This is a license key to remove advertising from Diabetes Journal. You have to install Diabetes Journal too. DO NOT UNINSTALL DIABETES JOURNAL! You will have to close Diabetes Journal in order to remove advertising).

****************************

Diabetes can be a scary but manageable disease. Let Diabetes Journal helps you by making it easy to track things like Glucose levels, Blood Pressure, HbA1c, and more! With it's elegant, easy to use interface, you'll be able to quickly enter and view your information.

Features include:
- mulitple profiles (lets you track details for more than 1 person)
- Calendar to view all of your entries for a specific day
- variety of graphs and reports
- export your information to CSV and even PDF files! A great way to send your information to your doctor.
- calculator to quickly convert between various measurement types
- supports both mmol/L and Mg/dL for measuring glucose
- support both % and mmol/mol for hemoglobin measurements

title: Type 2 diabetes
description:
"Diabetes is a life-long disease that affects the way your body handles glucose, a kind of sugar, in your blood.

Most people with the condition have type 2. There are about 27 million people in the U.S. with it. Another 86 million have prediabetes: Their blood glucose is not normal, but not high enough to be diabetes yet.

What Causes Diabetes?
Your pancreas makes a hormone called insulin. It's what lets your cells turn glucose from the food you eat into energy. People with type 2 diabetes make insulin, but their cells don't use it as well as they should. Doctors call this insulin resistance.

At first, the pancreas makes more insulin to try to get glucose into the cells. But eventually it can't keep up, and the sugar builds up in your blood instead.

Usually a combination of things cause type 2 diabetes, including:
Genes. Scientists have found different bits of DNA that affect how your body makes insulin.

Extra weight. Being overweight or obese can cause insulin resistance, especially if you carry your extra pounds around the middle. Now type 2 diabetes affects kids and teens as well as adults, mainly because of childhood obesity.

Metabolic syndrome. People with insulin resistance often have a group of conditions including high blood glucose, extra fat around the waist, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol and triglycerides.

Too much glucose from your liver. When your blood sugar is low, your liver makes and sends out glucose. After you eat, your blood sugar goes up, and usually the liver will slow down and store its glucose for later. But some people's livers don't. They keep cranking out sugar.


Bad communication between cells. Sometimes cells send the wrong signals or don't pick up messages correctly. When these problems affect how your cells make and use insulin or glucose, a chain reaction can lead to diabetes."

Most people with the condition have type 2. There are about 27 million people in the U.S. with it. Another 86 million have prediabetes: Their blood glucose is not normal, but not high enough to be diabetes yet.

What Causes Diabetes?
Your pancreas makes a hormone called insulin. It's what lets your cells turn glucose from the food you eat into energy. People with type 2 diabetes make insulin, but their cells don't use it as well as they should. Doctors call this insulin resistance.

At first, the pancreas makes more insulin to try to get glucose into the cells. But eventually it can't keep up, and the sugar builds up in your blood instead.

Usually a combination of things cause type 2 diabetes, including:
Genes. Scientists have found different bits of DNA that affect how your body makes insulin.

Extra weight. Being overweight or obese can cause insulin resistance, especially if you carry your extra pounds around the middle. Now type 2 diabetes affects kids and teens as well as adults, mainly because of childhood obesity.

Metabolic syndrome. People with insulin resistance often have a group of conditions including high blood glucose, extra fat around the waist, high blood pressure, and high cholesterol and triglycerides.

Too much glucose from your liver. When your blood sugar is low, your liver makes and sends out glucose. After you eat, your blood sugar goes up, and usually the liver will slow down and store its glucose for later. But some people's livers don't. They keep cranking out sugar.


Bad communication between cells. Sometimes cells send the wrong signals or don't pick up messages correctly. When these problems affect how your cells make and use insulin or glucose, a chain reaction can lead to diabetes."

title: BG Monitor Diabetes Pro
description:
Upgrade to BG Monitor Pro to unlock additional features and support development.

PRO FEATURES
• Complete insight details.
• Food database.
• Unlimited insulin types.
• Filter entries and statistics with tags.
• Automatic backups of data and settings.
• Automatic reminders to check BG after meals and out of range BG.

BG Monitor is a new diabetes tool, made for how you want to manage your diabetes. Blood glucose trends are identified to notify you of needed adjustments - saving you from staring at your logbook. Insulin is automatically calculated when you enter your blood glucose and food so that you can quickly get back to what matters most.

Finally, a diabetes app that's as smart as you.

TRACK EVERYTHING
Record your blood glucose, food, insulin, exercise, and more. Tag your entries to find them faster or take a picture of your meal to remember exactly what you ate.

SMART ANALYSIS
Gain insight into your numbers, without the work. Automatically identifies trends and notifies you if adjustments are needed.

DETAILED STATISTICS
Track your progress with comprehensive statistics and graphs. Filter your data and search by date to find exactly what you're looking for.

SEND REPORTS IN SECONDS
Don't waste time creating a spreadsheet. Instantly share reports of how you're doing with your doctor and loved ones.

BUILT FOR YOU
Dial in your targets and ratios to automatically calculate insulin for each meal. Supports both U.S. and international units of measurement (mg/dL and mmol/L).

GET THINGS DONE
Designed for speed so you can get back to what matters most. Create entries right from your home screen or record blood glucose directly from reminders.

Need help?
Visit https://www.bg-monitor.com/

Know another language?
Help translate at https://gowong.oneskyapp.com/collaboration/project?id=47648

recentChanges:
v8.0.1 - April 19, 2017
• Blood glucose trends are now automatically identified with Insights.
• New bottom navigation for quicker access to Entries, Statistics, Food, and Insights.
• Self-managed food database is now available for all users.
comments: This app has most of the basic data needed. Most people eat/drink the same things over the course of a week (i.e., milk) If these food items could be copied to the saved area or tagged somehow for quick selection. The food database could also have a seeable field for the brand names of products.
I've paid two times for this app. I went with this app for the easy use. The food data base sold me and it still doesn't work. It would be nice for some tech help to get this feature working.
Best app I've found to help calculate bolus as well as corrections and track carb consumption. Just with there was a basal function.

Revised--I don know what changed but I can no longer give this 5 stars. The daily, and thus 30 day average are now calculated incorrectly. Today for example I was 67, 167, and 119. Making the daily average 117. The app says after I put in the 119 that my daily went from 115 to 134.  This makes no sense and is incorrect. The 30 day on my meter is 112, same readings entered into the app and the app says 130. Very annoying. I'll be looking for a new app despite liking the other features.   I've been type 1 for 50 years now--this is the best program i have found so far--simple to use and only what's needed to help keep things in control.  Only wish it came combined  with a program like fit day that had food carb values so i only had to use one program.

I highly recommend this app. It is by far the best app I've tried for man aging my diabetes. I now have:  • an extensive database of foods I      eat that are cutomised to featuring my key information  • the ability to easily work out how much insulin to bolus as the app calculations are customised to match my known sensitivity variations throughout the day  • a graph tracking my trends making it simple to see if I need to make any adjustments for improved management of my blood glucose.  I have been using this app for several months now and it does everything I need it to. As a result I can make informed decisions which have improved my overall diabetes management markedly.

title: Diabetes Logs
description:
This is a simple to use Diabetes logging app that can improve your life with diabetes.

Unlike other apps that are burdened with options and unnecessary bloat, Diabetes Logs keeps it simple to use and understand.

Some of the features are:

* The ability to browse your data online and offline 

* New entries will be synced automatically to the cloud in case you are not online

* Simple to understand stats and graphs that will make your progress noticeable

* The option to share your data with your health care team easily in a CSV format from which your physician can filter and sort the data any way they please


Diabetes Logs is also available on iOS, you can access your data from an iOS device as well.

title: GlucoMe
description:
A personal diabetes management application.
Provides log, charts, reminders and alerts, statistics, ability to share, estimated HbA1c and more. Can connect to your clinic.
Connects to GlucoMe blood glucose monitor as well as to Accu Chek Guide, Contour Next One, Walgreens True Metrix Air, CVS Health True Metrix Air Bluetooth blood glucose monitors and more.

summary: A personal diabetes and glucose management application.
recentChanges:
New Home - manage and measure
Simpler login
Bug fixes
comments: It's ok. Definitely not great. • No way to log med dosages, especially as I want to track how much insulin I'm taking each time and with certain readings. Haven't been using the app all that long, but more than long enough to be frustrated with having to • repeatedly kill the app, • turn off my meter, • turn them back on and "hope" it updates. This morning it took no less than turning the meter on and off at least 5 or 6 times and app at least 3 or 4 kills before it finally picked up the current reading. There's no where I've found that you can hit a refresh for it to activate and upload a reading. The "Connect" on the Home does nothing. You can tap and try swipe in every possible direction with absolutely nothing happening with the app.

This app is easy to use, with a clean dashboard and an intuitive interface. It appears that some potential functions yet are to be developed fully, as evidenced by filter options and suggested titles in reports. However, it is a good app for monitoring blood glucose and better than the one provided by the manufacturer of my device.
Great app. Just love that I don't have keep a "diary" easy to keep track of weight and glucose trends.
Great app. Interfaces with my Bayer Contour Next ONE over Bluetooth to get my glucose readings.
wrong readings after recent upgrade, also after each upgrade app ask for all details each time and it is frustrating. Old data is no more available after updates, very poor quality app

title: Jade Insulin Dose Calculator
description:
The free Jade Logbook app is your loyal diabetes buddy. Track active insulin, blood sugar, bolus, basal, shots, food, carbs, weight, HbA1c and more. Effortless live Dexcom integration. Data is automatically synchronized to unlimited carers and your Health Care Team.

Jade calculates insulin doses, tracks active insulin to avoid stacking, and uniquely, warns of hypos hours ahead. It makes dose suggestions, reminds you of meals and basal insulin, and sounds alerts for predicted hypos and for hypo follow-up.

Jade makes diabetes safer today – during exercise, overnight and every day.

- Safest diabetes app in the world based on hypos avoided, dose improvements made and insights provided
- Winner of Stanford's 'DiabetesMine' Patient Voices competition


FEATURES:

• Designed for type 1s and other insulin users (type 2, type 1.5 / LADA, gestational diabetes)
• A1C estimate
• Meal time reminders, Post-meal reminders, basal reminders: never forget to check and log
• Hypo warning and hypo retest reminders
• Quick and easy logging
• Insulin dose calculator / Logger
  - multiple carb ratios and correction ratios
  - multiple BG targets
  - tracks active insulin / insulin on board in the same way as a pump
  - delayed eating suggestions - lower your A1C
  - factors for three levels of exercise, stress, sickness and pre-menstruation and more
• Hypo and BG prediction hours ahead
• Neat and clear graphs with ACTUAL blood glucose curves
  - no straight-line charts that miss important highs
  - helps to explain **expected** versus **unexpected** BGs
• Basal rates for pump users, and split dose logging
• Fully-featured reporting
• Multiple food databases and food estimation guide
• Time in Range / trends similar to CGMS but lower cost
• Live Health Care Team sharing
• Live syncing between multiple devices
• Tips for first-time users
• mmol/L or mg/dL blood glucose units
• Carbs in grams, portions, exchanges, BE, KE, CC
• Import CSV, Tab and XML data from 60 meters, pumps and CGMs
• Integrated safety warnings, coaching and guidance


INTEGRATION WITH FITNESS DEVICES

Jade integrates LIVE fitness data from 40 wearables and trackers


PREDICTION

See actionable coaching information within 6 hours. Remember to log BGLs, carbohydrate, insulin and exercise, and take note of coaching information. Touch the orange '?' coaching tips to see if your doses need adjustment. As your doses get better, predictions get better - try it for at least 14 days.


TEAM

Jade is designed by people with diabetes, for people with diabetes. Our CTO has had 27 years with T1 diabetes, and in a previous life used an insulin pump for 12 months. Our Quality Manager has a child with T1 diabetes who was diagnosed at 2 years old, now 11. 


We're always working to make Jade Logbook better, and we're counting on your feedback! Have a problem, criticism, question, suggestion, or praise? It’s all super important to us, and we'd love to hear from you.
Reach out to us at:

• jadediabetes.com
• support@jadediabetes.com
• twitter.com/jadediabetes
• facebook.com/jadediabetes

recentChanges: Rollback to v2.5
comments: Worst app ever. I paid for 6 months and the app would never open. I emailed and called multiple times and I was told it must be my phone. Asked multiple times for a refund with no response. As a diabetic I am in need of something reliable!

I like/don't like this app. The "predict" part is wrong 90% or more BUT it does let you know how much insulin is on board which is really helpful before bed or a workout. It tries really hard. I've tweaked it a lot. You can really fine tune the am blood sugar rises and changes to insulin sensitivity and sick day stuff too. So it is a mixed bag of goodies for a MDI Type 1, without a CGM. Helpful, but far from perfect or as advertised. I paid $50 for a year but I feel that is too much.

Incredibly overpriced for what you get per month and cannot turn off the message indicator. I have vision problems and wasn't able to see the number of messages so I'm constantly looking to see what the message is - oh sorry just that you haven't gone pro yet. The other two messages can't be fixed because the website errors when you try to update info 6hat would remove the messages. Product bypasses Google for it's subscription and uses Digital River. Feels a little fly-by-night. Uninstalling.

I have been using this app for a couple months and it works well. For me the app is overly complicated with too many settings/screens. I also wish I could turn off the predicted BG graph line. If I bolus correctly my BG trend is no where near the predicted graph line, so many times the app thinks I'm 200 when my BG is 150. And if I log the 150 BG the "coach" tells me I must have done something wrong.

Was a great app, now with ads added the usability is rendered useless. There is a ad over the save button as well as you are unable to scroll the page to click on save when you add your BGL and the carb count. I know now that the ads started after the trail period was done. Possible solution for the advert problem: Allocate the ad container size on the display until the ad have been loaded. When you open the app and the ads have not been loaded yet and you click on "Add" then the display with inputs are rendered without taking into account the advert that will be displayed in few seconds. If the app reserve the advert's space then when you are adding values the advert will not block the "Ok" or "Save" buttons.

title: Type 2 Diabetes
description:
Diabetes is a problem with your body that causes blood glucose (sugar) levels to rise higher than normal. This is also called hyperglycemia.

When you eat your body breaks food down into glucose and sends it into the blood. Insulin then helps move the glucose from the blood into your cells. When glucose enters your cells, it is either used as fuel for energy right away or stored for later use. In a person with diabetes, there is a problem with insulin.

Type 2 diabetes, once known as adult-onset or noninsulin-dependent diabetes, is a chronic condition that affects the way your body metabolizes sugar (glucose), your body's important source of fuel.

With type 2 diabetes, your body either resists the effects of insulin — a hormone that regulates the movement of sugar into your cells — or doesn't produce enough insulin to maintain a normal glucose level.
This application discussed type 2 diabetes in details for your daily reading. It contains all you need to know about type 2 diabetes.

KEY FEATURES INCLUDES:
*Symptoms of type 2 diabetes 
*Diet for type 2 diabetes
*Causes of type 2 diabetes 
*Treatment for type 2 diabetes 
*Medications for type 2 diabetes
*Type 2 diabetes in children 
*Risk factors for type 2 diabetes 
*Tips for how to prevent type 2 diabetes
*Receiving a type 2 diabetes diagnosis
*Complications associated with type 2 diabetes
*Managing type 2 diabetes
*Tips for Living Better Every Day
*7 Easy Breakfast Ideas
*7 Easy Lunches for Type 2 Diabetes 
*10 Delicious Diabetes-Friendly Dinners

The application is light in weight, it is almost 6MB so it will not use up much of your device storage. Install it and enjoy for free.There are many other similar apps in the catalog, take a look and install them. You can always reach me through my email address Zaidjaz10@gmail.com for any suggestion or complaint. 

***************DISCLAIMER AND CREDITS***************
The contents of this Application are just for educational purposes, they should not be considered as a Medical consultation, see a certified medical professional for diagnosis.
All credits for the contents of this application goes to https://www.healthline.com/ and 
 https://www.everydayhealth.com. Take a look at these websites to learn more. Thank you

title: Easycarb: Diabetes Nutrition & Carb Tracker
description:
Easycarb is the world's first complete nutrition & carb tracker for people with Type 1, Type 2 and gestational diabetes.

It is designed to help you keep your diabetes and nutrition in check at home or on the go. 

Use it as a standalone app, or coupled with the dedicated portable Bluetooth Smartscale for unparalleled precision!

APP FEATURES:

Customizable Food Database

Integrated USDA’s food database displays nutritional information for over 240.000 basic and whole foods as well as prepared and commercial dishes.

Nutrition Tracker

Easycarb provides a detailed nutritional breakdown of every meal, including Total Carbs, Sugar, Protein, Fat, Fibre and Calories.

Dedicated Bluetooth Smartscale

Take your nutrition tracking to the highest level with the bundled Easycarb Bluetooth Smartscale! The scale automatically connects to the app and provides precise nutritional insight into every meal.

Blood Glucose Tracker

Track your blood glucose values at the touch of a button. Overview your blood glucose values on a daily, weekly, monthly and even yearly basis.

Set Your Goals

Easycarb lets you set and pursue daily nutritional goals (carbohydrate target) and preferred blood glucose ranges, allowing you to stay focused and on track.

Customizable Reminders

Set a custom push-notification reminder to help you stay on top of your blood glucose checks! The reminders will automatically display on any connected wearables (smartwatches etc.) for additional convenience.

Bolus Insulin Calculator [Coming soon] ☆

Carb-to-Insulin and Bolus Insulin calculators provide bolus estimates for logged meals, based on your unique sensitivity profile.

Export PDF Report [Coming soon] ☆

The powerful integrated activity tracker enables you to export a personalised PDF Report to share with your physician or caregiver.

HOW THE SCALE WORKS:


Step One

The scale weighs the food item or meal and sends the data to the mobile app via Bluetooth.

Step Two

Based on the users' input, the app calculates the exact amount of nutrients as well as other values for the given meal.

Step Three

The logger keeps track of every meal and blood glucose measurement, so you don't have to.

SUPPORT & FEEDBACK:

We are working hard to continuously develop additional functionalities for our users. We are always looking for improvements and strive to develop the best diabetes self-management tool on the market! 

Do you have feedback or questions? 
Please get in touch at: info@easycarb.org
Find out more at: www.easycarb.org

Thank you for your support! 
Your Easycarb team

title: BEAT Diabetes & Prediabetes
description:
BEAT Diabetes has been produced with clinicians and patients to support people who might develop diabetes, or have developed it. Knowing more about this condition, can help some people to take simple steps to avoid developing the condition in the future.

For those who already have a type 1 or type 2 diagnosis, the app can help you learn how your diet, exercise and lifestyle can help you cope with the condition. The app also has information on support groups that can help you. 

This app is not diagnostic in any way, nor does it offer clinical advice. It presents public health information regarding diabetes by using 3D videos and explainer-style videos, images and text.

This app is funded with funds awarded from NHS England Staffordshire’s technology enabled care programme.

title: Diabetes Meal Plan
description:
The Diabetes Meal Plan is a 7 Day Diabetic Diet Meal Plan makes a diabetic diet simple to follow with nutritious and tasty meals that help to regulate blood sugar.
A diet on diabetes simply involves eating fairly healthy foods and adhering to daily mealtimes.
A diet for diabetes is a healthy eating plan that is naturally high in nutrients, and low in fat and calories. The essential components are fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. For most people, a diet on diabetes is probably the safest meal plan.
A diabetes diet is based on eating three meals a day at regular intervals (Breakfast, Lunch, and dinner). This will help you to use the insulin that your body produces.
Following your healthy eating schedule is the easiest way to keep your blood glucose level under control, and avoid diabetes problems. And if you choose to lose weight, you can tailor it to your own goals. Other benefits include in a diabetes diet, aside from controlling your diabetes. Given that a diabetes diet recommends large amounts of fruits, vegetables, and protein, your risk of cardiovascular diseases and certain types of cancer is likely to be reduced. And in the future consuming low fat dairy products may reduce your risk of low bone mass.

Important Notes
You need to meet with your doctor and dietitian to establish an eating plan that will work for you when you have diabetes. Use healthy foods, portion control and preparation to track the blood glucose level if you break from your accepted diet you run the risk of fluctuating blood sugar levels and more serious problems.
This app features includes;

-Overview About the Diabetic Diet 
-7 Days Meal Plan Menu Guideline 
-Diabetes complications
-Bmi Calculator & Bmi Info
-App Info (privacy policy & Disclaimer)

Finally, the best way to achieve body goal is to be consistent, disciplined, and to follow the dietary guidelines. Having a simple exercise will give an effective result.

We wish you Good Luck and All the Best on your Healthy Diet Journey!

title: Nutrition Diabetes
description:
The Nutrition Diabetes helps the patients to self-manage Diabetes trough nutrition, using interactive tools. This app gives the patient important information regarding the most common doubts about nutrition for patients with this condition in an understandable way. This app also allows the patient to know how many calories should be eating in order to maintain the weight. Another amazing functionality of this app is a food dairy where the patient can record the food eaten. The patient can then show these records to the doctor and together improve the patient’s quality of life.

Besides, the user can test its knowledge regarding Diabetes and nutrition in an amusing way through a little and fun quiz. 

Some information provided may not be valid for residents of other countries due to variations in medical practice and drug approval and indications.

This patient education application provides patients and Health Care Practitioners with easy to access information on Diabetes management.

Reserved only for BBD’s Partners.

title: DIABETES TREATMENT App
description:
IMPORTANT:
*Users who have APKs with previous version, may need to receive android.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission*

_________________


This app contains about Diabetes Treatment. Learn everything and you will find tips and knowledge for treating diabetes and knowing the causes, symptoms, etc.

Diabetes is a disease that is the result of your body not producing enough insulin. Insulin is a hormone produced by your body that helps to turn sugars into energy. The symptoms of diabetes are increased thirst, increased urination, constant hunger, weight loss, irritability, blurred vision, and fatigue. While each symptom alone is harmless, the combination of symptoms could mean that you have diabetes. And, if left untreated, diabetes can become a serious illness and can put you at a higher risk for other, more serious illnesses, such as heart disease and stroke.


In this app, we will disscuss the following topics:

• Understanding Diabetes - Diagnosis and Treatment
• Diabetes Treatment For Types I and II
• Diabetes Treatment and Guidelines
• Diabetes Treatment - Which Treatments are Effective
• An Overview of Diabetes Types and Treatments
• Everything You Need to Know About Diabetes
• What Are Symptoms Of Type 2 Diabetes in Children?
• How Does High Blood Sugar (Hyperglycemia) Feel?
• Herbal and Natural Remedies for Diabetes
• 10 Tips On How To Reverse Diabetes Naturally


And much more..


[ Features ]

- Easy & simple guide book app
- Periodic update of contents
- Support Offline Database 
- Shareable contents
- You can ask questions from our experts
- Send us your suggestions and we will add it


A little words about Diabetes Treatment:

Times were when being diagnosed as having diabetes was the end of the world though today, however with great advances in technology and medical science there's less reason to be worried as there are a variety of different diabetes treatments to look after the issue including taking medicines while it's also feasible to do without them. However, after you are diagnosed as having diabetes you must straight away talk to a physician who will then prescribe the best diabetes treatment for your personal case.

Though it is feasible to take diabetes treatment without turning to medicines and injections, the final straw would be the sort of diabetes that affects you and its causes as well as your present state of being. Among the other diabetes treatments that you need to think about using is performing lots of exercise while chalking out a correct diet has additionally proved to be extraordinarily effective.

Since you form certain habits that are a consequence of your diet and exercise program, this is one superb way of improving your diabetes problem as it helps to reduce the chance of complications while also brings blood sugar levels to controllable levels. And, if that is not enough, this sort of diabetes treatment can also help in preventing the illness under certain circumstances.

Diabetes treatment and knowing how to treat diabetes effectively will allow you to achieve optimum health. Understanding what the best treatments available for type 1 diabetes as well as type 2 diabetes is essential. The most important point to remember for all types of diabetes is to implement a healthy diet plan as well as regular exercise.


Download Diabetes Treatment now to read more..

title: Control Your Diabetes
description:
When you have diabetes, a primary goal is to keep it under control. Here are some simple things you can do each day to help achieve that goal.

Exercise
Regular physical activity helps you feel better. It also improves your sensitivity to insulin, which means it works better in your body. Because it does, your blood sugar levels can become more stable.

Exercise can also help ease stress.

If you aren't active now, start slow. Then build up how much exercise you get over time. Shoot for 4 to 7 periods of activity each week. Try to make each period last for at least 30 minutes. And you don't have to work out at the gym to be active. Take the stairs instead of an elevator, or park at the far end of the lot. Both add exercise to your daily routine.

Have a realistic goal and make a plan. What exercises will you do, and when will you do them? For example, you might plan to walk 30 minutes most days on your lunch break.

Change your activities often enough so you don't get bored. You can do aerobic activities like walking or jogging. And resistance exercises like working out with weights offer another option. Whatever you do, don't forget to stretch before and after each workout session.

It's important to realize that exercise lowers your blood sugar. Talk to your doctor about whether you need to adjust your meds or insulin dose to keep your levels high enough.

Eat a Well-Balanced Diet
Having diabetes shouldn't keep you from enjoying a bunch of different foods.


Try to fill half your plate with non-starchy vegetables such as:

Asparagus
Broccoli
Carrot
Cucumber
Salad greens
Squash
Tomato
You can also get protein from vegetarian things like tofu.

Stick to whole-grain foods. If you eat cereals, check the ingredients and make sure whole grain is first on the list.

Examples of whole grains include:

Brown rice
Bulgur (cracked wheat)
Reduce Stress
If you're stressed, you may exercise less, drink more, and not watch your diabetes as closely.

Stress can raise your blood sugar and make you less sensitive to insulin. When you're stressed, your body adopts a "fight or flight" response. That means it will make sure you have enough sugar and fat available for energy.

Studies of people with type 1 diabetes found blood sugar levels go up for most people under mental stress and down for others. If you have type 2 diabetes and you're feeling pressure, your glucose will go up.
descriptionHTML:
When you have diabetes, a primary goal is to keep it under control. Here are some simple things you can do each day to help achieve that goal.

Exercise
Regular physical activity helps you feel better. It also improves your sensitivity to insulin, which means it works better in your body. Because it does, your blood sugar levels can become more stable.

Exercise can also help ease stress.

If you aren't active now, start slow. Then build up how much exercise you get over time. Shoot for 4 to 7 periods of activity each week. Try to make each period last for at least 30 minutes. And you don't have to work out at the gym to be active. Take the stairs instead of an elevator, or park at the far end of the lot. Both add exercise to your daily routine.

Have a realistic goal and make a plan. What exercises will you do, and when will you do them? For example, you might plan to walk 30 minutes most days on your lunch break.

Change your activities often enough so you don't get bored. You can do aerobic activities like walking or jogging. And resistance exercises like working out with weights offer another option. Whatever you do, don't forget to stretch before and after each workout session.

It's important to realize that exercise lowers your blood sugar. Talk to your doctor about whether you need to adjust your meds or insulin dose to keep your levels high enough.

Eat a Well-Balanced Diet
Having diabetes shouldn't keep you from enjoying a bunch of different foods.


Try to fill half your plate with non-starchy vegetables such as:

Asparagus
Broccoli
Carrot
Cucumber
Salad greens
Squash
Tomato
You can also get protein from vegetarian things like tofu.

Stick to whole-grain foods. If you eat cereals, check the ingredients and make sure whole grain is first on the list.

Examples of whole grains include:

Brown rice
Bulgur (cracked wheat)
Reduce Stress
If you're stressed, you may exercise less, drink more, and not watch your diabetes as closely.

Stress can raise your blood sugar and make you less sensitive to insulin. When you're stressed, your body adopts a "fight or flight" response. That means it will make sure you have enough sugar and fat available for energy.

Studies of people with type 1 diabetes found blood sugar levels go up for most people under mental stress and down for others. If you have type 2 diabetes and you're feeling pressure, your glucose will go up.
summary: Lifestyle Changes to Help Control Diabetes

title: Diabetes Diary
description:
Intended for Diabetes type 2 (diabetes mellitus).

Diabetes Diary makes it possible to enter blood sugar value and to inspect previous values as a list or as a chart. The chart will also display max, min and averages.
It is possible to edit previous data, to delete previous data and to export and import the data.

Help text is available in the different modules.


Diabetes Diary is free to use but will sometimes show an ad when exiting the chart. Randomly, only once out of five times - and only in this situation.


If you also want to keep your weight under observation, there is an app with a very similar user interface. That app is named Weight Diary (WD).

title: Diabetes Type 2
description:
Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition that affects the way your body metabolizes sugar (glucose) an important source of fuel for your body.

With type 2 diabetes, your body either resists the effects of insulin a hormone that regulates the movement of sugar into your cells or doesn't produce enough insulin to maintain normal glucose levels.

Type 2 diabetes used to be known as adult-onset diabetes, but today more children are being diagnosed with the disorder, probably due to the rise in childhood obesity. There's no cure for type 2 diabetes, but losing weight, eating well and exercising can help manage the disease. If diet and exercise aren't enough to manage your blood sugar well, you may also need diabetes medications or insulin therapy.

title: Diabetes and Fast Food
description:
Diabetes and Fast Food helps you keep make good food choices if you want fast food or take out!

This app calculates your body mass index (BMI) and your daily caloric intake.
It will provide a warning if a BMI is high and helpful links.

The app provides you with a list of the Top 100 Common Fast Foods.
You can sort this list by type of food:Asian, Burgers, Ice Cream, Mexican, Milkshakes, Pizza, Sandwiches, and Misc.

Each food listing comes with calories per serving and glycemic index!
If you are diabetic, the information provided about these foods will help you make good food choices.

A high glycemic index means that the food metabolizes into sugar quickly and causes increases in your blood sugar.
Similarly, a low glycemic index means that the food metabolizes slowly into sugar and will not cause large increases in your blood sugar level.

title: Diabetes Cookbook
description:
Need diabetic recipes? Get great recipes for diabetics for your next meal. Taste of Home has lots of delicious recipes for diabetics.
There are many restrictions for any diabetic what to eat and what not. 
Based the allowed food stuffs, we are presenting a collection of diabetic recipes which can make your diabetic family member always happy and healthy. 
Basically our indian food can be adjusted a little to make delicious recipes out of that..
If take a balanced diabetic diet, you can reduce your medication and you can keep you glucose levels normal. 
It is completely related with the food you take. If your diet and weight is normal and up to recommended levels, you can reduce the requirement of Insulin you need. We have developed this app keeping those points in mind so that your diabetic levels remain normal but still you eat tasty and delicious food. 
After all, being diabetic is not your mistake. 
Try our collection of diabetic recipes which feature sugar-free and low-sugar variations on everything from cheesecake to ketchup.
Delicious diabetes recipes to help you follow your diabetes meal plan.
Diabetic-friendly cakes, cookies, and more low-sugar desserts, plus dinner ideas. See more than 500 recipes for diabetics.

title: Diabetic Calculator Full
description:
For all those addicted to fancy app features, this app got none. It's workhorse for people struggling with T1 diabetes.
If you were using trial version of Diabetic Calculator, you have to know that it will start to nag you to buy full version after 4 mths from last update. Install this version, then in trial version perform "backup", and then "restore" in this version. Whole stored data will be transferred.
 
Application is mainly aimed at diabetics T1, it may be of some use for other types of diabetes.

Diabetes, particularly type 1, is a very serious illness, restricting freedom of  the way you eat. 
To give some more freedom in choice of meals, diabetes educators teach patients to calculate their carbohydrates intake in their food, which in turn, together with current glucose level, can optimize amount of insulin they should inject.
 But, off-course you have to read nutrition labels, weigh your meals and do some math. 

Because my wife has fallen sick with type 1 diabetes, after visits to diabetic educators, I decided to write for her simple program where she can create database of foods she eats, and which will do carbohydrates counting for her.

 I used desktop database application and put it on her laptop.
After about 3 years of her using software religiously before every meal, somebody asked me if I could write application version of program for  smartphone. 
This applications does not create fancy reports, sends emails to your doctor, reads world foods database or scans bar codes on packaging.
When you start, it only contains  carbohydrates and calories info for basic foods like apple, potato, water etc..
 My wife, and you, put nutrition info into calculator, as you get new foods from the shop. And that's it, till you get something new to eat...Or you cook new meal, out of recipe, or your fantasy, you give it a name and put into database. Carbohydrates and calories are calculated for you. 
You can also judge "by eye" carbohydrates in your meal, and calculator will give you equivalent of insulin you have to counter it with (plus glucose correction).
 My wife's' glucose meter and its software takes care of all diabetic statistics, and it's not big deal to send email with reports it creates, to her doctor, she does it every fortnight.
I've added statistics screen, where she can view her data statistics over chosen period of time, to get quick idea how she goes ( with glucose, carbohydrates and calories).
 But mainly she wants to have database of carbohydrates content of foods she actually eats, either ready food or self-prepared meals, to use it to compile her meal and let application to calculate carbohydrates content. 
Then measure glucose level and get suggested insulin dose based on her meal carbohydrates content and blood glucose level.
Too complex apps only create confusion, especially among older people.

Units of glucose level are irrelevant (mmo/L or mg/dL), provided Target and Glucose Correction Factor are expressed in the same units!

title: Diabetes Self-Management
description: Diabetes Self-Management is a magazine that is devoted to managing the effects of diabetes on everyday life. The magazine publishes self-care tips, articles on diabetes research, and diabetes-friendly recipes. Diabetes Self-Management magazine is known well for publishing helpful self-care tips. One recent article talks about why it is important to manage blood pressure and blood cholesterol levels as carefully as blood glucose levels. One helpful entry titled Travelling with Diabetes instructs readers on how they can make it through plane trips and long vacations without eating the wrong foods or going without important pieces of monitoring equipment. Each issue of Diabetes Self-Management magazine contains articles on new diabetes research. One issue explores canagliflozin, a new drug used to treat type 2 diabetes that is said to work differently than other drugs used for the same purpose. Another article asks the question How much do you know about protein? and talks about the effects of protein on the levels of diabetes patients. Readers of Diabetes Self-Management magazine are treated to countless diabetes-friendly recipes. The magazine has recently featured a recipe for Quinoa and black bean salad, which it calls free of gluten, full of taste. The magazine publishes recipes for everything from breakfast foods like muffins and crepes to desserts like chocolate brownie ice cream pie, all diabetes-friendly. A subscription to Diabetes Self-Management magazine makes a great gift for anyone with diabetes who would like access to self-care tips, articles on new diabetes research, and countless diabetes-friendly recipes. On our website, you can either order a new subscription for yourself or as a gift, or you can easily renew a subscription to Diabetes Self-Management.

title: Diabetes Tracker App: Blood Glucose & Cholesterol
description:
Diabetes Tracker App is a great, easy and most comprehensive tracker app for Android, helping people track and manage their diabetes or pre-diabetes, to keep track of blood glucose and control carbs. Whether you had diabetes for years, or you are newly diagnosed, or diagnosed with pre-diabetes.

When you have diabetes, your blood sugar (aka blood glucose) levels may be consistently high. Over time, this can damage your body and lead to many other problems. Our app manage blood glucose quick and easy logging.

Diabetes tends to lower "good" cholesterol levels and raise triglyceride and "bad" cholesterol levels, which increases the risk for heart disease and stroke. Studies show a link between insulin resistance, which is a precursor to type 2 diabetes, and diabetic dyslipidemia, atherosclerosis and blood vessel disease. In order to prevent heart disease and stroke its good to keep log of Cholesterol level. 

Use HbA1c conversion calculator to convert HbA1c to Average Blood Sugar Level. The HbA1c level in your blood indicates what your average blood glucose level has been in the past 2 to 3 months. Everyone, whether non-diabetic, pre-diabetic, type 1 diabetic or type 2 diabetic has some degree of sugar in their blood.

Diabetes Tracker App Features:

• Quick and easy logging (blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight etc.)
• Designed for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes
• Estimated HbA1c & HbA1c conversion calculator
• Choose Glucose Target (ADA, NICE, AACE, Custom)
• Reminders;
• Daily, weekly and monthly graphs and analysis
• Assistant gives tips and more
• Backup to Google Drive and export data to CSV
• Import from CSV
• Free support (average response time under 24 hours!)
• Accesibility features
• Opt-in to support diabetes research anonymously through the app
• 100% Offline work

Diabetes Tracker App Features:

• Quick and easy logging (blood glucose, HB1AC, Cholesterol, Blood Pressure, Ketones, Body Weight etc.)
• Designed for both type 1 & type 2 diabetes
• Estimated HbA1c & HbA1c conversion calculator
• Choose Glucose Target (ADA, NICE, AACE, Custom)
• Reminders;
• Daily, weekly and monthly graphs and analysis
• Assistant gives tips and more
• Backup to Google Drive and export data to CSV
• Import from CSV
• Free support (average response time under 24 hours!)
• Accesibility features
• Opt-in to support diabetes research anonymously through the app
• 100% Offline work

title: Type 2 Diabetes Causes
description:
Type 2 diabetes, the most common type of diabetes, is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high. Blood glucose is your main source of energy and comes mainly from the food you eat. Insulin, a hormone made by the pancreas, helps glucose get into your cells to be used for energy. In type 2 diabetes, your body doesn’t make enough insulin or doesn’t use insulin well. Too much glucose then stays in your blood, and not enough reaches your cells.
The good news is that you can take steps to prevent or delay the development of type 2 diabetes.
Type 2 diabetes (T2D) is more common than type 1 diabetes with about 90 to 95 percent of people with diabetes having T2D. According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s report, 30.3 million Americans, or 9.4% of the US population have diabetes. 
More alarming, an estimated 84 million more American adults have prediabetes, which if not treated, will advance to diabetes within five years.
It’s necessary to make a diabetic diet for type 2 diabetes, 
Type 2 Diabetes App Features:
•	What is Type 2 Diabetes? 
•	Signs of Diabetes. 
•	Diabetes Symptoms.
•	Type 2 Diabetes Symptoms. 
•	Food for Diabetics.
•	Preventing Type 2 Diabetes.
•	How to Reverse Diabetes Naturally.

title: Diabetic Diet Plan
description:
A perfect diet plan for diabetic patient! This app gives diabetic patients a hustle free, medicine free life 

For a diabetic patient, Diet is important. Foods for diabetics are a very big problem for a diabetic patient. So, we made this easy for them. Our Diabetic Diet Plan app is the one stop solution for them. He or she doesn’t have to search recipes and food options here and there. Now by only one click he or she can get everything they want. 

 Diabetic Diet Plan app is an app which can guide you that what type of food in what amount you should take to balance your system.  
 Methods used by the App

There are some methods in the application which is followed for deciding that which food you should take by what amount. The methods are like the plate method, Carb -counting, Diabetes Exchange System, Glycemic index. The perfect method of diet and the best diabetic diet will help you to maintain the glucose and cholesterol content in blood and also it helps to maintain the blood pressure. All these things help you to stay fit and well.

 Healthy Diet for diabetic patient

For a diabetic patient, a healthy diet should contain more fruits and vegetables. Mainly green vegetables are very much preferable to them.Along with that whole grains, Low-fat dairy products, fish, and poultry products are also good for them.

 Food you should avoid if you are a diabetic patient

There are some foods to avoid with diabetes also. If you are a diabetic patient you should not eat any processed meat as they contain high sodium which affects the blood pressure. In grain avoid white flour, white bread, pasta, noodles etc. Avoid starchy vegetables like corn, potato, pea and a high-fat dairy product like butter, cheese etc. Don’t eat canned fruits, syrup etc as they contained high in sugar.

Diabetic Diet Plan app contains:

•	20 Worst Foods For Diabetics
•	20 Super Foods which are Good for Diabetics
•	Top 20 Tips to Beat Diabetes
•	Diabetic Diet Plan from American Heart Association
•	The Important of Diet in Diabetes
•	Facts about Diabetes that You should Know
•	Exercise to Control Diabetes
•	9 Simple Ways to Increase Your Physical Activity
•	Control Diabetes Through Walking - 4 Top Tips
•	Complications Of Diabetes And Their Timeline
•	4 Major Organs that are Damaged by Diabetes
•	5 Easy Tests for Diabetes
•	Diabetes Treatment and How often you should Visit the Doctor
•	Metabolic Surgery - a Possible Cure for Diabetes?
•	Diabetic Retinopathy Treatment
•	8 Ayurvedic Remedies that may control Diabetes
•	Physical activity in Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes (T1DM)
•	Diet Tips for Type 1 Diabetes

So, If you can take care of these little facts you are in out of danger. But a quicker solution is also there with you which is Diabetic Diet Plan app who will take care all these things for you. 

So, why are waiting for go and install it now?

title: Diabetes Coach
description:
Gather Health is your all-in-one diabetes coach and logbook app, that gives you free personalized advice from a real health coach. It has been designed by endocrinologists specifically for people with diabetes. Reduce your blood sugar and HbA1c levels by actively managing your diabetes.

☆☆☆ Spring 2016 Offer ☆☆☆ UNLIMITED free coaching with a real diabetes health coach if you install the app before March 31st. Keep your new year’s resolutions and beat your diabetes! (see terms below)

GATHER HEALTH GIVES YOU MORE
✓ Answers - Ask questions to a team of qualified health coaches and nutritionists, anytime, anywhere
✓ Knowledge - Get the most up-to-date diabetes information with our fun interactive quiz game
✓ Reminders - Always remember to take your medications and measure your blood sugar
✓ Log Sugars - Record your blood glucose readings from your glucometer, and track on charts and graphs
✓ Log More - Log your blood pressure, weight and medications, and share your records with your coach

YOUR PERSONAL DIABETES COACH
✚ Answers your questions on nutrition, exercise, sleep and stress, to help you live a healthy lifestyle for diabetes.
✚ Gives you advice on preventative medicine, common diabetes complications and related diseases such as heart disease.
✚ Provides help and information about lab tests, foot exams and eye tests.
✚ Helps you eat a healthy diet, and avoid fad diets such as the cabbage soup diet, the grapefruit diet and detox water.

Ideal for diabetics of all types: pre-diabetes, newly diagnosed, type 1 diabetes, type 2 diabetes, gestational diabetes, and juvenile diabetes.

BUILT BY MEDICAL EXPERTS
Gather Health’s Real Diabetes Coach & Logbook has been built by an experienced team of biotech, healthcare and pharmaceutical veterans, with expert medical guidance from epidemiologists, endocrinologists, and internists. Visit http://www.gatherhealth.com to read our research and whitepapers.

SPECIAL FEATURES
☆ Low cost - Free app, free coaching with a real diabetes health coach. (see terms below)
☆ Low size - Only 12 MB in size so it doesn’t take up much space on your phone
☆ Low data usage - Needs very little 2g/3g/4g mobile data, so it won’t use up your data plan
☆ Low power - Uses very little power, so it won’t drain your phone battery
☆ High quality - Beautiful app with great visuals, fun animations and helpful features
☆ High ratings - Patients love our app, giving us 4.5 stars on the Google Play Store

Give yourself the gift of free diabetes coaching, and start reducing your blood sugar levels today! Go ahead and install the app now.

For help and support, contact us at any time at help@gatherhealth.com

Important information:
Gather Health coaches cannot give you medical advice. The Gather Health app is not for use in medical emergencies. Consult a qualified doctor before changing your medications or lifestyle. Any data you provide will be kept confidential and not shared with third parties. See our Terms for more information. The unlimited free coaching offer allows for unlimited messages to be sent to and received from coaches for a limited time only. Gather Health reserves the right to terminate free coaching services at any time.

title: Diabetes Type 2
description:
Choose This not That for Diabetes Type-2. Inside this colorful app, you will find easy to follow suggestions on how to improve your health through nutrition and the food choices you make every day. This app provides comprehensive and actionable guidelines for how to combat diabetes and complications associated with it. If you rather tackle health issues through proper nutrition and lifestyle changes then this app is for you! Last update: Nov. 2019.

A number of powerful, unique and interactive features make this app so different and superior to others in the market:

• Is this food good for me? This feature answers the common question about suitability of various food items for your personal situation. And it does so in an easy to understand and colorful graphic form.

• Recipes. Most popular recipes on leading web sites.

• Health issues often come our way in groups of two or more. They are often caused by other health complications or result in other illnesses and risks. In case of diabetes, there are numerous symptoms and health risks that might accompany it. Thus, we have included separate guidelines for the following common conditions along with diabetes: Alzheimer’s disease, diabetic retinopathy, erectile dysfunction, hearing loss, heart disease, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, high triglycerides, kidney well-being, nerve well-being, obesity, osteoporosis, and skin well-being. Also included are guidelines for DASH diet (recently recommended for diabetes patients).

• Top-5 recommendations on what to eat/do, and what not to.

• Food Suggestions. The best food choices within a food group, based on your personal profile. An extremely valuable tool when at restaurants or when grocery shopping. Also included are suggestions on appropriate life style choices, alternative therapies and herbal remedies, when such options are promising and available to you.

• ACTIONABLE information on what is good, what is bad, and what is neutral for your condition(s). We single out specific food items, and give you an ordered list of helpful and harmful foods within each food group. 

The primary sources used by Personal Remedies (PR) are US government sources such as USDA, NIH (National Institute of Health) agencies, leading clinics & universities.

PR is the publisher of the largest collection of health and nutrition apps for chronic conditions in the market, based in metro-Boston, home to the highest ranking healthcare providers and academic institutions in the world.

This app is updated by our team on an ongoing basis. Updates happen seamlessly, and do NOT require frequent inconvenient downloads.

“This technology was developed using the most current clinical evidence-based information that is available in the US. Behind this technology there is a team of expert clinicians, scientists, endocrinologists, oncologists, and other specialists who are passionate about bridging the gap between expert knowledge and the patient.“ 
Katya Tsaioun, PhD, Nutrition, Tufts University; L.D.N.

 “Proper nutrition and other alternative treatments show great promise in preventing and treating many of the illnesses that we deal with every day. I encourage all my patients to follow appropriate nutrition and research other options for themselves. The Choose This Not That series are an excellent step towards improving people’s knowledge in this area.”
Shahin Tabatabaei, MD
Mass General Hospital; Harvard Medical School

“The Choose This Not That series of apps provide dietary recommendations focused on common chronic health problems. They are easy to understand and thus easy to implement into daily life. Most doctors would find it difficult to discuss dietary recommendations at the level of detail found in the series. They should serve as a valuable complement in helping people manage chronic illnesses through dietary and lifestyle modifications.”
Andrew S. Lenhardt, MD 
Lahey Clinic, Hamilton, MA

title: Dexcom CLARITY
description:
Dexcom CLARITY is a diabetes management application for CGM users. It provides relevant insights into users’ retrospective glucose values, patterns, and trends over time.

Dexcom CLARITY is an important part of your Dexcom CGM system. It can help you identify glucose patterns and, with your healthcare professional, determine the potential causes of those patterns.

Dexcom CLARITY users experience up to 15% increased time in range (70-180mg/dL) as compared to non-users.*

Log in with your Dexcom account to:
•	Keep tabs on your time in range, patterns and other key metrics.
•	Allow clinics to access to your data and reports to make appointments more efficient.
•	Set Time in Range goals.
•	Turn on daily or weekly notifications and emails.
•	View, save, print, and email all reports.
•	Connect to partner apps for more features and benefits.

This app store should not be used as your first point of contact to resolve technical or customer services issues. In order to protect your privacy and personal information, and promptly resolve any technical or customer services issues you are having with any Dexcom product, please contact 1-888-738-3646.

Dexcom is required to follow up with customers regarding product-related complaints. If Dexcom determines that your comment/complaint requires follow up, a technical support representative will attempt to contact you to gather more information regarding your comment/complaint.

*Parker AS, Welsh J, Jimenez A, Walker T. Insights from big data (2): Benefits of self-guided retrospective review of continuous glucose monitoring reports. Diabetes Technol Ther. 2018;20(S1):A-27.

*Parker AS, Welsh J, Jimenez A, Walker T. Insights from big data (2): Benefits of self-guided retrospective review of continuous glucose monitoring reports. Diabetes Technol Ther. 2018;20(S1):A-27.
summary: Track your glucose management between clinic visits with Dexcom CLARITY Reports.
recentChanges:
Dexcom CLARITY has updated Time in Range to reflect clinical standards with new range names, a fifth Very High range, and recommended ranges from an international consensus.
Dexcom CLARITY settings default to reflect these ranges. Tap Profile > Glucose Ranges to review and adjust your ranges.
comments: I could never keep my bg in control before I started using the CGM/this app. My extreme highs and lows have settled into a very minimally variable horizontal line within range most days. My time in range is phenomenally good. It's as if I was blind before, but now have glasses to see. I love this app! And I am feeling so much better because my glucose control is better. I have energy, can think/concentrate, have lost weight because I'm no longer "feeding the insulin, and sleep better.

Once again...for as advanced as the G6 is, the app should be compatible with more than just the "latest" IPhone. I have Samsung Fold and was sad to find it wasn't compatible. Only 20% of population has an Iphone. The receiver reminds me of a flip phone I had 10 years ago. Please update for MODERN Android phones.

Another crappy app by dexcom with huge design flaws. It takes forever to produce a report and during that time if the app loses focus (if you switch to another app or if your screen turns off) the report production will cancel without warning and without informing you. So you have to wait several minutes while touching the screen every few seconds to make sure your screen doesn't turn off while the app does its thing. This is ridiculous.

Yeah, it helps me to refine and schedule my meal changes, periods of activity, BG insulin corrections and my exercise program by showing BG pattern changes periodically throughout the previous day. Kudos for a reliable, well-considered app for helping the diabetic and his care team in dealing with the challenges of diabetes!

Extremely helpful. A must needed tool to control and figure out best treatment, like what foods trigger my blood sugar. I keep a low sugar / carb diet. I have a difficult situation. I also take ani rejection meds steroids which cause my blood sugar to go up as well without this app I was always guessing now I know exactly how to control my issues when they're high which they are many times I'm able to correct due to my steroids

title: Habits Diabetes Coach
description:
Habits Diabetes Coach is a diabetes app that provides coaching along with a tracking program. It is a diabetes management app designed for those who are:

<> Prediabetes, Starting insulin treatment, and Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes

Habits Diabetes Coach is more than just a diabetes logbook. It is a diabetes management app that helps you achieve moderate weight loss and lifestyle changes to prevent and delay diabetes development. It comes with:

<> Blood sugar or blood glucose tracker with hyperglycemia and hypoglycemia feedback
<> Food tracker with US and International food database, South Asian/India, and Singapore. 
<> Food recommendations, meal plans and recipes
<> 16-week of diabetes lessons
<> Automated Coaching and Upgraded 1:1 Personal Coach service
<> Automatic activity tracker
<> Medication reminders, Insulin Tracker, and other vital signs trackers


***IT IS EFFECTIVE***
Habits is designed based on the landmark study Diabetes Prevention Program (DPP), which proves that a 7% weight loss with moderate exercise regime can get your diabetes symptoms under control. Thousands of diabetes patients had successfully taken control of their diabetes through weight loss and lifestyle changes. Designed by a team of scientists, nutritionists, and engineers from MIT and Harvard.

***IT IS SIMPLE ***
Get personalised diabetes coaching.
Use a simple tracker to keep a track of your progress.
Receive daily tips and messages, tutorials, quizzes and gentle nudges.
Chat with your coach at anytime and receive answers (usually within hours).
Share your medical reports with your doctor.

***PERSONAL CERTIFIED DIABETES COACH***
Ask questions and receive answers from a certified diabetes coach and nutritionist.

It's never too late to start taking control of your diabetes. Track your blood sugar, HbA1C, weight, food with a diabetes tracker and get personalized diabetes coaching from a certified coach. Diabetes treatment has never been easier!! So time to get started!!

title: Diabetes Management
description:
Manage your diabetes easily by keeping a track of your blood sugar along with your meals and exercise with the Diabetes Management application.

A monthly calendar, a blood sugar tracker and physical activity record sheet have been provided along with a weekly meal planner. A checklist has also been provided, that helps you to self-evaluate your outpatient management of diabetes.

The Monthly Calendar sheet provides a note taking feature to help you keep a track of your health on a daily basis for the entire month. Checkmark functionality has been provided, that lets you highlight the important dates easily. These might include visits to the doctor, drug prescription, etc.

Blood Sugar Log sheet helps you record your blood sugar readings on a daily basis for two months. The log has been designed for taking the readings four times per day. Special notes about the reading can also be entered at your convenience. The record is also visualised with the help of a graph.
Note: Please enter the date in the following format: mm/dd/yy

The Activity Log sheet lets you track and summarise the time spent on the physical activities on a weekly basis. The activities may range from walking, jogging, cycling, etc. to any other physical exercise that has been prescribed by your doctor. Goals can be set on a daily basis, and can be compared regularly using the log sheets.

The Weekly Meal Planner helps you plan and organise your meals on a weekly basis. This is even more essential if you have been asked to follow a certain diet plan. A separate section for “notes” has also been added, to help you write down any important points alongside. A shopping checklist is provided so you can manage your groceries in an organised manner.

The Medical Guidelines checklist has been created on a set of performance measures that have been created by The American Medical Association (AMA), Joint Commission on Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations (JCAHO), and the National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA), that can be used to evaluate outpatient management of an adult patient with diabetes mellitus. This sheet has been intended as a self-check for the user.

We have added simple sharing capabilities like email and print for all the sheets to help you make the efforts a collaborative endeavour. We hope you find our simple app productive and would like to hear your comments.

title: How To Cure Diabetes
description:
What all types of diabetes have in common is that they cause people to have too much glucose (sugar) in their blood. But we all need some glucose. It’s what gives us our energy. We get glucose when our bodies break down the carbohydrates that we eat or drink. And that glucose is released into our blood.

We also need a hormone called insulin. It’s made by our pancreas, and it’s insulin that allows the glucose in our blood to enter our cells and fuel our bodies.

If you don’t have diabetes, your pancreas senses when glucose has entered your bloodstream and releases the right amount of insulin, so the glucose can get into your cells. But if you have diabetes, this system doesn’t work.

title: My DiabetesConnect
description:
We are proud to introduce worlds first complete diabetes care app, My DiabetesConnect(Diabetes is not just about blood glucose)!
 
My name Dr Ryizan Nizar MD MRCPUK and I am determined to make diabetes care more accessible and affordable to everyone.

Where you live or what you earn should not determine the Diabetes care you get!

This App offers people the opportunity to store and track their health data for a small yearly subscription. It will also graph all your data and show what your targets are as well as your current standing in relation to such targets.

My DiabetesConnect will do all the thinking for you.
 
The dashboard:- With this one screen you can see an overview of your diabetes control with colour-coded tiles that change colour to indicate which aspects need urgent action/above target/at target. The tiles will also notify when a certain test is overdue. Now you are in complete control.

PDF Reports:- Create and share PDF reports with your doctor in an instant. This will help your doctor make more informed decisions by analysing all your records over months/years.

Blood Glucose Screen:-This app has meal specific targets and you can instantly know if a certain blood glucose reading is high with the App's easy to understand colour coding. Readings will go red if it needs immediate attention, amber if high and green if in target.
 
BMI Screen- App will auto calculate your target weight once you enter your height and you will be able to easily see your progress in achieving these target.
 
HbA1c Screen:- Track your HbA1c over several years and you can easily track your progress, after all, Diabetes is all about trends.
 
Blood Pressure:- Now it's easy to track your blood pressure with My DiabetesConnect, know when it is too high and you can see trends over months/years.
 
Kidney Function (Blood test):- Track your kidney function overtime to make sure they are healthy. See the trends and know early if kidney function is deteriorating.
 
Kidney Function(Urine test):- Often this is the first sign of trouble that would indicate diabetes is starting to affect your kidney. Knowing early can help your doctor treat early and prevent/delay kidney failure.

Cholesterol:- Track your cholesterol over months/years. It's all about trends.

Eye and Feet Check:- Keep a track of your eye and feet screening. The App will remind you when you are due for your next eye appointment.

Medication:- Now you can keep track of all your medications with this one App. What's more, you can also store all your stopped medications so your doctor knows what you had been on before. that didn't work.

Diagnosis:- Keep track of all your diagnoses.
 

SUPPORT:
We're always working to make the My DiabetesConnect App better, and we need your feedback! Have a problem, criticism, question, or praise? Get in touch:
 
Email: support@mydiabetesconnect.co.uk
WhatsApp: Technical support can be accessed within the App.
WebSite: https://mydiabetesconnect.uk
Facebook: @diabetesRN
Instagram: @mydiabetesconnect

https://www.termsfeed.com/terms-conditions/144bfc4620e851d4e9d46b228fa15ad0

 
###
 
My DiabetesConnect: Try it free for 3 months and then ONLY £2.99 a Year(Or you can continue with the free version)
descriptionHTML:
We are proud to introduce worlds first complete diabetes care app, My DiabetesConnect(Diabetes is not just about blood glucose)!
 
My name Dr Ryizan Nizar MD MRCPUK and I am determined to make diabetes care more accessible and affordable to everyone.

Where you live or what you earn should not determine the Diabetes care you get!

This App offers people the opportunity to store and track their health data for a small yearly subscription. It will also graph all your data and show what your targets are as well as your current standing in relation to such targets.

My DiabetesConnect will do all the thinking for you.
 
The dashboard:- With this one screen you can see an overview of your diabetes control with colour-coded tiles that change colour to indicate which aspects need urgent action/above target/at target. The tiles will also notify when a certain test is overdue. Now you are in complete control.

PDF Reports:- Create and share PDF reports with your doctor in an instant. This will help your doctor make more informed decisions by analysing all your records over months/years.

Blood Glucose Screen:-This app has meal specific targets and you can instantly know if a certain blood glucose reading is high with the App's easy to understand colour coding. Readings will go red if it needs immediate attention, amber if high and green if in target.
 
BMI Screen- App will auto calculate your target weight once you enter your height and you will be able to easily see your progress in achieving these target.
 
HbA1c Screen:- Track your HbA1c over several years and you can easily track your progress, after all, Diabetes is all about trends.
 
Blood Pressure:- Now it's easy to track your blood pressure with My DiabetesConnect, know when it is too high and you can see trends over months/years.
 
Kidney Function (Blood test):- Track your kidney function overtime to make sure they are healthy. See the trends and know early if kidney function is deteriorating.
 
Kidney Function(Urine test):- Often this is the first sign of trouble that would indicate diabetes is starting to affect your kidney. Knowing early can help your doctor treat early and prevent/delay kidney failure.

Cholesterol:- Track your cholesterol over months/years. It's all about trends.

Eye and Feet Check:- Keep a track of your eye and feet screening. The App will remind you when you are due for your next eye appointment.

Medication:- Now you can keep track of all your medications with this one App. What's more, you can also store all your stopped medications so your doctor knows what you had been on before. that didn't work.

Diagnosis:- Keep track of all your diagnoses.
 

SUPPORT:
We're always working to make the My DiabetesConnect App better, and we need your feedback! Have a problem, criticism, question, or praise? Get in touch:
 
Email: support@mydiabetesconnect.co.uk
WhatsApp: Technical support can be accessed within the App.
WebSite: https://mydiabetesconnect.uk
Facebook: @diabetesRN
Instagram: @mydiabetesconnect

We have fixed some annoying bugs.

comments: Great app. Very easy to use and provides a detailed report for tracking and providing real data to assist doctors and myself in diabetes management. Highly recommend it for its functionality and value for money in the detail they put into the app. Useful tips and news feeds as well provide helpful information at a glance. First time user and lifetime customer now (or when I can beat this disease). I found using the app helps me be more accountable about my diabetes management. Real data beats anecdotal evidence and the figures don't lie. With the inclusion of a free text field in the Blood Glucose section in the next version update, I'll now be able to input my food intake as well which will bring together everything I need to collect the data that will help me monitor my progress and diet. Keep up the good work Dr Nizar and thank you for providing this app.

Very easy to use App, like how the dashboard is organised. Tiles change colour according to my latest results so it's easy to know what to focus. Meal time targets are easy to understand. Helpful tile on tracking weight. Finally like how it's so easy to share data with PDF.

Amazing app. Can save all diabetes tests in one place, dashboard is amazing with tiles that change color to depending on the latest result! Like the meal specific targets. HbA1c is converted to an average blood glucose so it's easy to relate to it.
Excellent very user friendly app to have all your health records related to diabetes at your finger tips. Highly recommended to anyone who wants to keep track on past records.
Very helpful app

title: NutriBullet Recipes - Smoothie Recipes (Diabetics)
description:
This NutriBullet Diabetic diet app brings you Diabetic Friendly Smoothie recipes that can help in regulating blood sugar and supply the body with a more stable source of energy. 

People with diabetes or even those that are considered pre-diabetes should keep their blood sugar levels within the normal range to prevent having complications.  A person may experience several symptoms such as hunger, sweating, blurred vision, nausea, headache, and lethargy when blood sugar is either very low or very high. These symptoms can lead to a more serious or life-threatening condition. 


This Smoothie Recipes app aims to help people with diabetes in managing their blood sugar levels by using diabetic diet recipes made with natural and fresh ingredients such as fruits and vegetables, seeds and nuts, dairy, tea, and water. 


All of the Smoothie recipes in this app are high in fiber, vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants to promote optimum health. Bear in mind that good nutrition and proper timing of meals are crucial in diabetes management. 


To get the most out of your ingredients, you will need a powerful machine like “NUTRiBULLET Superfood Extractor”. This amazing machine works wonders, simply place all your ingredients in the tall glass and process. It only takes less than a minute to enjoy a glass of nutrient-packed and delicious smoothie. 


Get started by DOWNLOADING this Diabetic Friendly Nutribullet Smoothie Recipes app 



Featured recipes in this app:

title: HC And - Diabetes type 1
description:
Denne app ”HC And - Diabetes type 1” er udviklet i et samarbejde mellem H.C. Andersen Børnehospital, Odense Universitetshospital, indlagte børn og deres familier og 10:30 Visuel Kommunikation.

HC And er patientinformation for børn i alderen 4-7 år og har til formål at forbe-rede og mindske utrygheden hos børn for hvem mange hospitalsbegreber er helt ukendte.

”HC And - Diabetes - type 1” er en introduktion til et generelt patientforløb for de yngste børn, deres familie og omgangskreds. Informationen er med speak - af en barnestemme - og animation i genren ”Læring gennem leg med computer/tablet”.

Børn i denne aldersgruppe lærer og erkender ved leg og konkret information.  Indlagte børn kan hurtigt blive “fyldt op” med en masse information. Derfor er HC And bygget op af korte sekvenser i børnehøjde, så “nye” kan starte her.
 
Historierne i HC And afspejler virkeligheden og de foreskrevne kliniske retningslinjer. Hospitalspersonale kan bruge dette materiale som et pædagogisk værktøj til at skabe en fælles forståelsesramme med barnet.

Der er fokuseret på tryghed og kommunikation i børnehøjde, så barnet også selv kan tilegne sig specifik viden uden hjælp fra voksne. Vi opfordrer både forældre og hospitalspersonale til at bruge de små forberedelsesfilm i relation til og i takt med børnenes behov for information og forberedelse.

Nogle af filmene afsluttes med spørgsmål og kan være en hjælp for dig, til at vende situationen til en dialog og sikre at emnerne er forstået. HC And kan også bruges, som en del af efterbehandlingen, når I er kommet hjem og dit barn har behov for at bearbejde sine oplevelser igen og igen.

Historierne om Niko og diabetes - type 1 eksisterer også i en version til afvikling på pc/mac. I computerversionen er ”Diabetes - type 1” en integreret del af HC Ands store hospitalsunivers med mange generelle undersøgelser, som er fælles for mange udredningsforløb. hcand.dk er frit tilgængelig og ”Diabetes - type 1” kan man finde under ”diagnoser”.
